is a city by the beach in

. It is called the "little Spanish village by the sea" because many of the buildings have a rustic and antique Spanish look to them. People from San Clemente pride themselves on the laid-back and closely knit community traditions that are practiced in this small town. Not only does the culture have a great influence on all the people who live there, but anyone who visits is also sure to experience this feeling as well.

There are 2 train stations in San Clemente, one at the pier, and one at North Beach. Both San Clemente Pier and San Clemente North Beach is served by
, only on weekends, to Oceanside, Los Angeles, and San Bernardino. San Clemente Pier is also served by
to San Diego, Los Angeles, and Santa Barbara, daily.

The beach is the largest attraction in San Clemente. If you're artsy, there's usually a good exhibit going on at the
, former home of San Clemente founder Ole Hanson. Local teens tend to venture north to the
for entertainment, but the local movie theater, the Krikorian, is relatively cheap and well-run.

value: content=It is easier to exercise when you have a view like this to look at. From Riviera Beach to the pier is one mile, and from the pier to North Beach is one mile. If you’re looking to step up the rigor of your work out, you can run the stairs along the way.

content=Some inexpensive ways to enjoy what SC has to offer is to check out the scenery. Leslie Park is a small park that overlooks a beach where most locals visit. From this point, you can see all the way down to the edge of State Beach, the Pier, and even down to Dana Point.

Avenida Del Mar street is the heart of Village San Clemente. There are a lot of charming shops, cafés, and restaurants on this historic stretch. 
If you are looking to bring something for the kids, just stop in

. They have reasonable prices and they carry from infants up to size 16 for both boys and girls. If you are looking for a souvenir, they have adult and matching kid button up shirts boy the men and dresses for girls with all the local cities from San Clemente to Laguna Beach. For the older kids, there is
for the sporty beachy wear and lots of cute stuff for the ladies at shops like
which is more upscale. There are a lot of stores with fun home décor items like

for your souvenirs like shells and shirts and lots of other items. There are a lot of cute antique stores up and down Del Mar that you should at least poke into. 
They even have ice cream and sandwiches.
Right next door is
. They have all sorts of goodies including vegan beef jerky.

value: content=A rather high-end women’s clothing store, but very good quality clothes and trendy fashion.

content=Trestles outlet is in south side San Clemente. They sell the overstocked bathing suits and beachwear from companies such as RipCurl that are also in department stores, but they are much cheaper.

There are a variety of local restaurants that are fairly priced and simply delicious.

value: -- Unique cuisine with a Hawaiian influence. Family owned and affordable. Very tasty "Man Fries" and "Khalua Pig Nachos"
-- Creamy frozen yogurt that is perfect after a long day spent at the beach. And it's a healthy indulgence!
-- Best deep dish pizza in town. Also must try the "mothership" cookie and ice cream for dessert.

-- Open for breakfast and lunch. Home of San Clemente's famous Acai Bowls and amazing Chinese Chicken Salad. Prices range from $8-$10 for a salad, and about $7 for the Acai Bowl (this is fairly standard in comparison to other restaurants of this nature).
-- Famous for their "Whitestone" Pizza. Inexpensive and informal dining.
-- Family owned and operated, delicious Mexican food made by locals who are originally from Mexico.
-- Another great place for Mexican food. Very affordable and tasty, and theres a drive-through window for your convenience.
-- Great breakfast and lunch place across from the pier
-- Great breakfasts on Camino Real in the heart of the village.
-- For good seafood in the best location in town on the pier. Expect a bit of a wait in summer.
-- For San Clemente's take on Cajun cuisine, El Camino Real just north of Palizada.
-- Italian deli with great pizza and homemade specialties, on Del Mar.
-- For the best burritos in town, on Camino Real.
, Avenida Del Mar. This is a rather formal restaurant and the prices tend to be high, but there are also items on the menu that are less expensive.
, Corner of Palizada and El Camino Real.
, Avenida Del Mar   --  Warm friendly service, great food and family atmosphere makes it a San Clemente locals' favorite for Italian food.
, El Camino Real  --   Upscale steakhouse with a full bar and live music.
Avenida Del Mar  --  For dessert, chocolate dipped strawberries or a special treat.
content=Pizzas, pasta, and sandwiches. Dining outdoors and family friendly.

content=This restaurant branches off of the southern California favorite "Nick's" which is detailed above. South of Nicks differs because it features a high class mexican menu with items that originate from south of the border. Keeping consistent with the fairly high pricing of Nick's, this place is of a more formal nature than most mexican restaurants in the San Clemente area.

content=A sports bar and restaurant. They serve a plethora of dishes ranging from enchiladas to cheeseburgers. A standard bar scene. There are also a few Billiards tables as well as video games. People of all ages gather here. It is a family restaurant that usually transforms into a place only for adults later into the night.

content=A bar where many youngsters congregate. Sports bar with multiple TVs, Billiards tables, video games, and a restaurant in the back. OC Tavern also offers amazing appetizers and happy hour speicals.
name=Hampton Inn and Suites San Clemente
address=2481 S.El Camino Real, San Clemente, CA 92672
content=This hotel has a rather confusing format to it, but the employees are all very friendly and accommodating. It is right next to the San Clemente Golf Course. It has a weight room and a pool.
address=111 S. Ave. De La Estrella
name=Casa Tropicana Boutique Beach Front Inn
address=610 Avenida Victoria, at the pier
directions=Avenida Del Mar to the pier

content=Overlooking the sun-drenched sands of the dazzling Southern California Coast, Casa Tropicana invites you to experience a one-of-a-kind space that partners gracious scope and exceptional comfort with accommodating details and design.

Spanish-inspired architecture, ocean views, stylish comfortable decor, thoughtful amenities and at the pier, beach and sand in San Clemente, Orange County, CA. 

Casa Tropicana…not just a San Clemente address, a California state of mind.

Voted “Best of Orange County“-O.C. Register 
"Best of San Clemente" People's Choice, SC Times, Gold Medal Winner
"Stylish, Beach-Inspired"-Sunset Magazine
address=34734 Pacific Coast Hwy, Capistrano Beach, CA 92624

content=This hotel is only rated with two stars, however, it is much more inexpensive than many of the options in San Clemente. Although it is not technically located in the city of San Clemente, it is right along Pacific Coast Highway leading you south directly into the Spanish village by the sea.
